Organic cotton

Cotton represents nearly half the fibre used in the textile industry and only part of it is what’s called organic cotton. If sustainably and ethically produced, organic cotton is a great alternative to conventional cotton and it’s likely the most popular choice for an eco-textile. Contrary to conventional cotton, it uses far less water, no insecticides, reduces contamination of groundwater, poses no risk of cancer to workers, and encourages biodiversity. Globally, conventional cotton cultivation accounts for about 5% of global pesticide use even though it is cultivated only on about 2.5% of global arable land. From a circularity perspective, being a natural fiber, it has the added benefits of being 100% biodegradable, given there were no harmful chemicals used during the processing of the fiber. Certain certifications can help with the evaluation. The Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS), covers the processing, manufacturing, packaging, labelling, trading and distribution of textiles, ensuring that both environmental and social standards, such as safe and hygienic working conditions, no workplace discrimination and fair pay rates, are respected. This isn’t however the only certification focusing on organic cotton. There are also others like Organic Content Standard (OCS), Cotton madein Africa Organic, the EU Organic Standard, bioRe Sustainable Cotton or the Fairtrade Cotton. 

Recycled polyester

Recycled polyester is a better alternative to a virgin polyester. It is made of recycled plastic bottles or old clothes. Using recycled instead of virgin polyester reduces our dependency on fossil fuels, requires less energy, and produces fewer carbon emissions. By using plastic waste, it is diverted from oceans and landfills. The problem of releasing the microfibers and biodegradability remains the same though, which is why we encourage you to use the microplastic filters in your washing machine like here or microplastic bags like here.

settings.product_care_value:
• Cold wash inside out with similar colours at 30 degrees; close all zips and tie all cords before washing

• Do not tumble dry, air dry instead; reshape while damp, lay flat to dry

• Do not bleach, embrace all colours

• Do not dry clean

• Do not iron, wear rumpled proudly // Iron low heat at 110 degrees inside out or wear rumpled proudly

• Use a laundry bag, stop microplastic pollution

• Never stop exploring, but explore responsibly ;)

This product contains recycled polyester, which releases microfibers to soil and oceans, which is why we encourage you to use the microplastic filters in your washing machine like here or microplastic bags like here.

settings.product_sustainability_value:
Circular design

............................

Sustainable

This product is produced in a sustainable way, which means that it is created in a way that can be sustained for this and future generations, while protecting both Planet and People producing it. It is produced by a Fair Wear Foundation Leader Stanley/Stella which, by using organic cotton, helps sustain natural resources and improve the livelihood of people involved in its production. For more information on our supplier read on.

Produced from certified materials

........................This product was designed with a great attention to its components, which in majority are certified: ..... the core fabric is Oeko-Tex / GOTS / GRS / ... certified and the trims are Oeko-Tex / GOTS / GRS / certified ..... While we are aiming at being certified ourselves, we rely on our suppliers and pay great attention to the materials we choose, to make sure they are healthy for you and the Planet. Even though we can't market ourselves as certified company, we want to chose the best and certified materials. We just find it the right thing to do and we want to be as transparent as we possibly can.

Organic materials

This product is made from organic fabrics, which means that the fiber is grown without toxic substances, fertilizers and polluting pesticides. This translates into higher product quality, healthier soils, protecting local habitats, increasing biodeversity and improving the livelihood of people involved in growing them. They are better for you, the People and the Planet.

Natural materials

........................

Recycled materials

This product contains recycled fibers, which supports the circular economy model, where all raw materials are kept in use as long as possible. Recycling means conserving natural resources and reducing waste, while preventing it from the landfills and incinerators.

settings.shipping_returns_value:
Shipping Costs

We offer free shipping for orders above 150 EUR. For orders below we will add a shipping cost of 4,95 EUR in Germany or accordingly cost from our price list per each European country. For detailed information read our Shipping & Returns page.

Delivery Times

Our delivery times are 2-4 days within Germany and 3-7 days within Europe. All orders are processed at our main hub in Füssen, Germany.

30 Days Return Policy

You have the right to cancel and return your order within 14 days, for any reason and without a justification. We want you to be happy with your purchase and make sure your products will be with you for a long time ahead, therefore we have an extended 30 days return policy. Go to our Shipping & Returns page to read more on our shipping and return details.

settings.subheading: WHAT ARE OUR PRODUCTS MADE OF
settings.title: RECYCLED FIBERS
settings.content:
Using recycled fibers supports the circular economy model, where all raw materials are kept in use as long as possible. Recycling means conserving natural resources and reducing waste, while preventing it from the landfills and incinerators.

Fun fact?
Even our brand label on this garment is made of recycled polyester!

settings.title: OUR CIRCULAR ROADMAP
settings.content:
We strive for sustainability and 100% circularity of every single product we share with you, but we're definitely not there YET.

Check our Circular Roadmap to learn how we are achieving it and read our Transparency Report to see where we are at.

If you have any questions about our products, we encourage you to reach out. We will be happy to share all information with you!

settings.title: ABOUT OUR SUPPLIERS
settings.content:
We believe in transparency and we want to share all information you need from us to make a fully conscious decision about your purchase.

This item was produced by the FairWear Foundation Leader Stanley/Stella in Bangladesh and finished at our manufacturer MerchYou in Slovakia, Bratislava. Learn more:

settings.content_left: Caring for the Planet, by creating travel capsule wardrobe for conscious travellers, designed with circularity at every step of the journey. Less is more. #LetsReloop
settings.content: You choose what you get in your inbox. We make sure it is providing value and inspiration to your travel capsule wardrobe.
